content.text: How TO - Mega Menu
Learn how to create a mega menu (full-width dropdown menu in a navigation bar).
content.html: Learn how to create a mega menu (full-width dropdown menu in a navigation bar).

content.text: Mega Menu
Try it Yourself »
Create A Mega Menu
Create a dropdown menu that appears when the user moves the mouse over an element inside a navigation bar.
content.html: Create a dropdown menu that appears when the user moves the mouse over an element inside a navigation bar.

content.text: Step 1) Add HTML:

content.code:
Home   News  
       
     
       

Mega Menu

     
     
       
         

Category 1

          Link 1           Link 2           Link 3        
       
         

Category 2

          Link 1           Link 2           Link 3        
       
         

Category 3

          Link 1           Link 2           Link 3
content.code_html:
<div class="navbar">
  <a href="#home">Home</a>
  <a href="#news">News</a>
  <div class="dropdown">
    <button class="dropbtn">Dropdown
      <i class="fa fa-caret-down"></i>
    </button>
    <div class="dropdown-content">
      <div class="header">
        <h2>Mega Menu</h2>
      </div>
      <div class="row">
        <div class="column">
          <h3>Category 1</h3>
          <a href="#">Link 1</a>
          <a href="#">Link 2</a>
          <a href="#">Link 3</a>
        </div>
        <div class="column">
          <h3>Category 2</h3>
          <a href="#">Link 1</a>
          <a href="#">Link 2</a>
          <a href="#">Link 3</a>
        </div>
        <div class="column">
          <h3>Category 3</h3>
          <a href="#">Link 1</a>
          <a href="#">Link 2</a>
          <a href="#">Link 3</a>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>

content.text: Example Explained
Use any element to open the dropdown menu, e.g. a
content.html: Use any element to open the dropdown menu, e.g. a <button>, <a> or <p> element.

content.text: Use a container element (like <div class="dropdown-content">) to create the dropdown menu and add a grid (columns) and add dropdown links inside the grid.
content.html: Use a container element (like <div class="dropdown-content">) to create the dropdown menu and add a grid (columns) and add dropdown links inside the grid.

content.text: Wrap a <div class="dropdown"> element around the button and the container element (<div class="dropdown-content"> to position the dropdown menu correctly with CSS.
content.html: Wrap a <div class="dropdown"> element around the button and the container element (<div class="dropdown-content"> to position the dropdown menu correctly with CSS.

content.text: Step 2) Add CSS:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* 
  Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* Add a 
  red background color to navbar links on hover */

/* 
  Show the dropdown menu on hover */
/* Create three equal columns that floats next to each other */

float: left;  width: 33.33%;  padding: 10px;  
  background-color: #ccc;  height: 250px;

/* Add a background 
  color on hover */

syntax_highlighting.text: /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* 
  Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* Add a 
  red background color to navbar links on hover */

/* 
  Show the dropdown menu on hover */
/* Create three equal columns that floats next to each other */

float: left;  width: 33.33%;  padding: 10px;  
  background-color: #ccc;  height: 250px;

/* Add a background 
  color on hover */

content.code_html:
/* Navbar container */
.navbar {
  overflow: hidden;
  background-color: #333;
  font-family: Arial;
}

/* Links inside the navbar */
.navbar a {
  float: left;
  font-size: 16px;
  color: white;
  text-align: center;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
}

/* The dropdown container */
.dropdown {
  float: left;
  overflow: hidden;
}

/* Dropdown button */
.dropdown .dropbtn {
  font-size: 16px;
  border: none;
  outline: none;
  color: white;
  padding: 14px 16px;
  background-color: inherit;
  font: inherit; /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */
  margin: 0; /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */
}

/* Add a red background color to navbar links on hover */
.navbar a:hover, .dropdown:hover .dropbtn {
  background-color: red;
}

/* Dropdown content (hidden by default) */
.dropdown-content {
  display: none;
  position: absolute;
  background-color: #f9f9f9;
  width: 100%;
  left: 0;
  box-shadow: 0px 8px 16px 0px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
  z-index: 1;
}

/* Mega Menu header, if needed */
.dropdown-content .header {
  background: red;
  padding: 16px;
  color: white;
}

/* Show the dropdown menu on hover */
.dropdown:hover .dropdown-content {
  display: block;
}

/* Create three equal columns that floats next to each other */
.column {
  float: left;
  width: 33.33%;
  padding: 10px;
  background-color: #ccc;
  height: 250px;
}

/* Style links inside the columns */
.column a {
  float: none;
  color: black;
  padding: 16px;
  text-decoration: none;
  display: block;
  text-align: left;
}

/* Add a background color on hover */
.column a:hover {
  background-color: #ddd;
}

/* Clear floats after the columns */
.row:after {
  content: "";
  display: table;
  clear: both;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* 
  Important for vertical align on mobile phones */

/* Add a 
  red background color to navbar links on hover */

/*

float: left;  width: 33.33%;  padding: 10px;  
  background-color: #ccc;  height: 250px;

/* Add a background 
  color on hover */

content.text: Example Explained
We have styled the navigation bar and the navbar links with a background-color, padding, etc.
content.html: We have styled the navigation bar and the navbar links with a background-color, padding, etc.

content.text: We have styled the dropdown button with a background-color, padding, etc.
content.html: We have styled the dropdown button with a background-color, padding, etc.

content.text: The .dropdown-content class holds the actual dropdown menu. It is hidden by default, and will be displayed on hover (see below). It is positioned to be visible right below the dropdown button, and the width is set to 100% to cover the whole screen.
content.html: The .dropdown-content class holds the actual dropdown menu. It is hidden by default, and will be displayed on hover (see below). It is positioned to be visible right below the dropdown button, and the width is set to 100% to cover the whole screen.

content.text: Instead of using a border, we have used the box-shadow property to make the dropdown menu look like a "card". We also use z-index to place the dropdown in front of other elements.
content.html: Instead of using a border, we have used the box-shadow property to make the dropdown menu look like a "card". We also use z-index to place the dropdown in front of other elements.

content.text: The :hover selector is used to show the dropdown menu when the user moves the mouse over the dropdown button.
content.html: The :hover selector is used to show the dropdown menu when the user moves the mouse over the dropdown button.

content.text: The .column classes are used to create three columns that floats next to each other inside the dropdown menu (to show different categories).
content.html: The .column classes are used to create three columns that floats next to each other inside the dropdown menu (to show different categories).
